findings.title: BC - Blacklists Addresses
findings.description: The contract owner has the authority to stop addresses from transactions and may take advantage of it by calling the `blacklistAddress` function.

findings.title: EIS - Excessively Integer Size
findings.description: The contract uses a bigger unsigned integer data type than necessary, consuming more storage space and requiring additional computational resources, resulting in higher transaction costs, longer execution times, and potential scalability bottlenecks.

findings.title: RRS - Redundant Require Statement
findings.description: The contract utilizes a `require` statement within the `add` function aiming to prevent overflow errors, but this check is redundant due to Solidity version 0.8.0 and later reverting on overflow and underflow.

findings.title: RSW - Redundant Storage Writes
findings.description: The contract modifies the state of variables without checking if their current value is the same as the one given as an argument, leading to redundant storage writes and unnecessary gas consumption.

findings.title: MFU - Misleading Function Usages
findings.description: The contract uses the `isReward` function and `_rewardList` variable with misleading names, suggesting reward functionality when they are actually used for blacklisting addresses.

findings.title: MEM - Misleading Error Messages
findings.description: The contract is using misleading error messages. These error messages do not accurately reflect the problem, making it difficult to identify and fix the issue.

findings.title: TUU - Time Units Usage
findings.description: The contract is using arbitrary numbers to form time-related values, which decreases code readability and prevents compiler optimization.

findings.title: MCC - Misleading Commented Code
findings.description: The contract contains commented-out code segments in the `_transfer` function which are redundant and can be misleading.

findings.title: AOI - Arithmetic Operations Inconsistency
findings.description: The contract uses both SafeMath library and native arithmetic operations, which can introduce inconsistencies and undermine safety measures, increasing the risk of unintended consequences.

findings.title: RSD - Redundant Swap Duplication
findings.description: The contract contains multiple swap methods that individually perform token swaps and transfer promotional amounts to specific addresses and features, introducing unnecessary complexity and increasing gas consumption.

findings.title: PVC - Price Volatility Concern
findings.description: The contract accumulates tokens from taxes to swap them for ETH. If the variable `swapTokensAtAmount` is set to a big number, then the contract will swap a huge amount of tokens for ETH, potentially leading to significant price volatility.

findings.title: MCM - Misleading Comment Messages
findings.description: The contract is using misleading comment messages. These comment messages do not accurately reflect the actual implementation, making it difficult to understand the source code.

findings.title: RSML - Redundant SafeMath Library
findings.description: The usage of SafeMath library adds complexity, overhead and increases gas consumption unnecessarily since Solidity versions greater than or equal to 0.8.0 provide native functionality for arithmetic operations.

findings.title: RSK - Redundant Storage Keyword
findings.description: The contract uses the `storage` keyword in a view function, which is redundant since view functions do not modify the state of the contract and do not perform any actions that cost gas.

findings.title: L02 - State Variables could be Declared Constant
findings.description: State variables can be declared as constant using the constant keyword to ensure that their values cannot be changed after being set, which decreases gas consumption of the corresponding transaction.

findings.title: L04 - Conformance to Solidity Naming Conventions
findings.description: The Solidity style guide is a set of guidelines for writing clean and consistent Solidity code. Adhering to a style guide can help improve the readability and maintainability of the Solidity code, making it easier for others to understand and work with.

findings.title: L05 - Unused State Variable
findings.description: An unused state variable is a state variable that is declared in the contract, but is never used in any of the contract's functions.

findings.title: L07 - Missing Events Arithmetic
findings.description: Events are a way to record and log information about changes or actions that occur within a contract. They are often used to notify external parties or clients about events that have occurred within the contract, such as the transfer of tokens or the completion of a task.
